nodes.Description:
CWE-588: Attempt to Access Child of a Non-structure Pointer
Casting a non-structure type to a structure type and accessing a field can lead to memory access errors or data corruption.
nodes.label: Attempt to Access Child of a Non-structure Pointer

nodes.Description:
CWE-192: Integer Coercion Error
Integer coercion refers to a set of flaws pertaining to the type casting, extension, or truncation of primitive data types.
nodes.label: Integer Coercion Error

nodes.Description:
CWE-843: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')
The product allocates or initializes a resource such as a pointer, object, or variable using one type, but it later accesses that resource using a type that is incompatible with the original type.
nodes.label: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

nodes.Description:
CWE-196: Unsigned to Signed Conversion Error
The product uses an unsigned primitive and performs a cast to a signed primitive, which can produce an unexpected value if the value of the unsigned primitive can not be represented using a signed primitive.
nodes.label: Unsigned to Signed Conversion Error

nodes.Description:
CWE-1389: Incorrect Parsing of Numbers with Different Radices
The product parses numeric input assuming base 10 (decimal) values, but it does not account for inputs that use a different base number (radix).
nodes.label: Incorrect Parsing of Numbers with Different Radices

nodes.Description:
CWE-194: Unexpected Sign Extension
The product performs an operation on a number that causes it to be sign extended when it is transformed into a larger data type. When the original number is negative, this can produce unexpected values that lead to resultant weaknesses.
nodes.label: Unexpected Sign Extension

nodes.Description:
CWE-681: Incorrect Conversion between Numeric Types
When converting from one data type to another, such as long to integer, data can be omitted or translated in a way that produces unexpected values. If the resulting values are used in a sensitive context, then dangerous behaviors may occur.
nodes.label: Incorrect Conversion between Numeric Types

nodes.Description:
CWE-704: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast
The product does not correctly convert an object, resource, or structure from one type to a different type.
nodes.label: Incorrect Type Conversion or Cast

nodes.Description:
CWE-197: Numeric Truncation Error
Truncation errors occur when a primitive is cast to a primitive of a smaller size and data is lost in the conversion.
nodes.label: Numeric Truncation Error

nodes.Description:
CWE-195: Signed to Unsigned Conversion Error
The product uses a signed primitive and performs a cast to an unsigned primitive, which can produce an unexpected value if the value of the signed primitive can not be represented using an unsigned primitive.
nodes.label: Signed to Unsigned Conversion Error
